title: Immigration Judge Zol Rainey"All Remands from Board of Immigration Appeals"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Immigration Judge Zol Rainey"All Remands from Board of Immigration Appeals"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The decisions issued by the Board of Immigration Appeals from December 2021 until the date of processing of this request, arising from cases decided by Immigration Judge Zol Damon Rainey, that were administratively closed, reversed, background check remand, and/or remand (including remands to a different IJ).

I would request any printouts, summaries, spreadsheets, reports, or other records or datasets that may encompass or address how many of removal orders included a negative credibility determination for any Respondent(s) for whom IJ Rainey issued removal orders in protection/form I-589 cases (in other words, decisions on Asylum, Wittholding of Removal, or Relief under the Convention Against Torture), after merits/individual hearings occurred, between December 2021 and the date of processing of this request.

All correspondence or communications in any medium (including but not limited to any email, fax, letter, text/SMS/MMS, memorandum, voicemail, audio recording, sticky-note, or any attachment thereto, and any conversion of any of the foregoing from a digital to analog form/format, or vice-versa) to or from IJ Rainey, from December 2021 through present time, regarding removal or any other immigration proceedings, containing the words "credibility," "credible," "incredible," "incoherent," "demeanor," "candor," "evasive," "non-responsive," "responsiveness," "inconsistent," "consistent," "consistency," "facial expression(s)," "body language," "standard language," or "addendum of law," or any abbreviation, contraction, misspelling, pluralization, or paraphrase thereof.

Copies of each and every "standard language addendum of law" or any substantially similar 'boilerplate' or 'template' document utilized by IJ Rainey as an exhibit in, as an attachment to, or as a drafting aid for any merits decision in a protection/form I-589 matter.

The requested records will be made available to the general public via a FOIA records clearinghouse, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes; rather, the results will be disseminated to interested individuals free of charge, and with no pecuniary gain to the Requestor, who is not the subject of any of these records. Thus, we would request that fees be waived.

Please search all records regarding agency business. You may not exclude searches of files or emails in the personal custody of your officials, such as personal email accounts. Records of official business conducted using unofficial systems or stored outside of official files is subject to the Federal Records Act and FOIA. It is not adequate to rely on policies and procedures that require officials to move such information to official systems within a certain period of time; I exercise and specifically preserve and assert my right to records contained in those files even if material has not yet been moved to official systems or if officials have, through negligence or willfulness, failed to meet their obligations.

If it is your position that any portion of the requested records is exempt from disclosure, I request that you provide an index of those documents as required under Vaughn v. Rosen, describe each document claimed as exempt with sufficient specificity to determine whether it should be exempt under FOIA, and discuss the consequences of disclosing, specifically identifying the reasons why a particular exemption is relevant and correlating those claims with the particular part of a withheld document to which they apply.

If it is your position that a record contains non-exempt segments, but that those non-exempt segments are so dispersed throughout the document as to make segregation impossible, please state what portion of the document is non-exempt, and how the material is dispersed throughout the document. If a request is denied in whole, please state specifically that it is not reasonable to segregate portions of the record for release.

You should institute a preservation hold on information responsive to this request. I intend to pursue all legal avenues to enforce my right of access under the FOIA, including litigation if that becomes necessary. Accordingly, the EOIR is on notice that litigation is reasonably foreseeable.

If it will accelerate release of responsive records to me, please also provide responsive material on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely yours,

Derrick J. Hensley

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FOIA Request to the Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)
📌 Address:
Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)
450 Columbus Blvd, Suite 2
Hartford, CT 06103


📌 Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request – Expedited Processing & ADA Accommodations Requested

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-200, et seq.), I request expedited processing and ADA accommodations for the following records:

Records Requested:
All records, communications, and case files related to CHRO Case #2510183, including but not limited to:

Internal communications between CHRO officials discussing this case.
Communications between CHRO and the Connecticut Office of the Attorney General.
Communications between CHRO and the Connecticut Department of Consumer Protection (DCP) regarding this case.
Any records related to ADA enforcement actions, decisions, or internal deliberations about CHRO Case #2510183.
All emails, memos, and written correspondence from January 1, 2024, to present discussing:

ADA Title II enforcement and compliance within CHRO investigations.
Whistleblower complaints related to disability rights enforcement.
Denials of accommodations for individuals with disabilities within CHRO’s jurisdiction.
All policies, procedures, or internal guidance used by CHRO when handling ADA complaints, disability discrimination cases, or whistleblower retaliation claims involving state agencies.

Any CHRO reports, memos, or correspondence sent to federal oversight agencies (DOJ, HHS OCR, EEOC) regarding ADA violations or CHRO Case #2510183.

Request for Expedited Processing:
I request expedited processing under Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d) due to:

The urgent public interest in ensuring CHRO is properly enforcing ADA protections.
Ongoing legal proceedings in CHRO Case #2510183, where delays in obtaining this information could impact my ability to seek justice.
Evidence of government suppression of civil rights enforcement and whistleblower retaliation, necessitating immediate federal review.
Please confirm expedited processing and provide an estimated date for the production of these records.

Request for ADA Accommodations:
As a person with a disability protected under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, I require the following non-negotiable accommodations:
✅ Electronic Only Communication – All records and responses must be provided in the body of the message and as PDF attachments. No physical mail or portal logins are permitted.
✅ Simplified Summaries for Complex Records – Any highly technical or complex documents must include a plain-language summary to ensure accessibility.
✅ Identification of Responsible Personnel – The names, titles, and contact information of the individuals handling this request must be provided.
✅ Detailed Justifications for Redactions or Denials – If any records are withheld, I require a full legal explanation under Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-210(b), with specific statutory citations.

If any accommodation is denied, please provide a written explanation and cite the specific legal basis for non-compliance under ADA Title II (42 U.S.C. § 12132) and Section 504 (29 U.S.C. § 794).

Delivery Format:
I request that the records be provided in electronic format to ensure accessibility. If this request is denied in whole or in part, please cite the specific legal exemption(s) and provide an index of withheld documents.

Please confirm receipt of this request within four business days and provide an estimated timeline for completion.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros 
ABI Resources

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

communications.subject: Welcome to the Hillsborough County Sheriff's Office Public Records Request Center
communications.communication:
Dear Harun Harun, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Hillsborough County Sheriff's Office.

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the incident involving TeddyJo Marie Fliam, 34, at the Walmart store on M-32 in Alpena County, Michigan, on September 29.

Location: Walmart, M-32, Alpena County, Michigan
Suspect: TeddyJo Marie Fliam, 34
Incident Summary: Fliam was arrested after being accused of skipping items while using the self-checkout at the Walmart store. After being confronted by a loss prevention worker, she allegedly became agitated, denied the theft, and left the store. Surveillance footage showed that Fliam had stolen over $1,000 worth of merchandise since April by failing to scan certain items. She was later arrested at her home and charged with first-degree retail fraud.

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident Involving Band Director at Jackson-Olin High School

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the incident that occurred on September 14 involving the band director at Minor High School in Birmingham, Alabama.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: September 14
Location: Jackson-Olin High School football field, Birmingham, Alabama
Suspect: director at Minor High School
Incident Summary: Following the end of a football game between Jackson-Olin High School and Minor High School, the Minor High School band continued playing music for at least 18 minutes after the game concluded. The band director was confronted by police officers after refusing to stop the performance. Bodycam footage shows the band director arguing with officers and telling them to "get out of my face," before being restrained and tasered. The director was later treated at the scene and transported to a local hospital. He was charged with disorderly conduct, harassment, and resisting arrest.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to the incident at Jackson-Olin High School, including any footage that shows the interaction between the band director and police officers, as well as any subsequent actions leading to his arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident Involving Carla Jefferson (Pinellas County Sheriff's Office)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the arrest of Carla Jefferson for repeated misuse of the 911 system.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Location: St. Petersburg, Florida
Suspect: Carla Jefferson, 51
Incident Summary: Jefferson was arrested after making over 12,512 phone calls to the St. Petersburg Police Department and Pinellas County Sheriff’s Office, accounting for approximately 10% of all incoming calls. Her calls were described as vulgar, threatening, and obscene, often holding up emergency lines. After receiving a notice of prosecution, Jefferson called the precinct demanding to be arrested but later refused to answer the door when officers arrived. She was charged with three misdemeanors related to misuse of the 911 system and harassing phone calls.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to Jefferson’s arrest, including footage of any interactions at her residence.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the arrest of Cori Lynne Ralston following a stabbing incident in Clermont, Florida.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date:  September 4, 2022
Location: Lake Ridge Circle, Clermont, Florida
Suspect: Cori Lynne Ralston, 18
Incident Summary: Deputies responded to Lake Ridge Circle after South Lake Hospital reported that a stabbing victim had left the emergency room without receiving treatment. Upon arrival, deputies found the victim sweating profusely and suffering from a deep stab wound that required transport to Orlando Regional Medical Center as a trauma alert. Initial statements from the victim’s mother falsely claimed the injury was accidental, but another relative later reported hearing an argument between the victim and Ralston. Deputies questioned Ralston, who admitted to arguing with the victim, spraying each other with a kitchen faucet, and then waving a knife, which ultimately stabbed the victim. Due to the severity of the injury, Ralston was arrested for aggravated battery with a deadly weapon and booked into the Lake County Jail.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to the incident, including footage of the initial response, witness statements, and the suspect’s questioning.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the arrest of Dixie Stiles and Macy Regan following a physical altercation on July 4, 2023, in Callaway, Florida.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:
Date: July 4, 2023
Location: 6530 Olokee St. and 6526 Olokee St., Callaway, Florida
Suspects: Dixie Stiles, 18, and Macy Regan, 23
Incident Summary: Deputies responded to an assault and battery call at 6530 Olokee St. An investigation determined that an unsupervised house party was occurring at 6526 Olokee St. Just after midnight, a physical altercation took place between Dixie Stiles and Macy Regan after Stiles accused Regan of stealing alcohol and vape pens. Regan allegedly pulled out a 9mm handgun before Stiles shoved it away, leading to a physical fight in which Regan bit off the top of Stiles’ ear. The injury was severe, and the ear was unable to be reattached. Both individuals sustained additional bruises and lacerations before being arrested.
I am requesting copies of body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to the incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the arrest of Jasmin Marie Watkins and several juveniles following a teen party disturbance at Playtime USA.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Location: Playtime USA, Hilltop Plaza Shopping Center, Hamilton Avenue, Mount Healthy, Ohio
Suspect: Jasmin Marie Watkins, 33, and seven juveniles
Incident Summary: Officers responded to Playtime USA after management decided to shut down a teen party early due to social media threats of a firearm being brought to the event. As partygoers exited into the parking lot, multiple fights broke out, leading to the arrest of several juveniles and Jasmin Marie Watkins. Watkins was charged with rioting, obstruction of justice, and resisting arrest for allegedly inciting the crowd and threatening an officer. Additional law enforcement agencies were called to assist, and pepper ball guns were noted as available to officers on the scene. Reports also indicated possible gunfire in the area.
I am requesting copies of body-worn camera footage from officers who were present during the response, crowd dispersal, arrests, and any interactions with Jasmin Marie Watkins and the juveniles involved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: PUBLIC RECORD REQUEST :: P001706-022425
communications.communication:
Dear Cody Harris: 
Thank you for submitting your request for the following records: Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to all awardees of the state's Electric Vehicle Charging Program. For each grant recipient, I request:

* Grant applications
* Progress reports, milestone reports, and other periodic reporting documents
* Documents containing proposed and actual charging station locations
* Budget documents, including proposed and actual expenditures
* Amendments or modifications to original grant agreements
* Final project completion reports, if available

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cody Harris

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-commerce-5573%252Fwashington-state-electric-vehicle-charging-program-181987%252F%253Femail%253Dcommercewa%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AABCmuzFKtmgaEDpBVZ8oaaurWw%3A1tmVcc%3AK_8lGdblEB62snyonBN54QiuRaT9ULcqLLafr2eq5hA 
 
Your request was received in this office on 2/24/2025 and given the reference number P001706-022425 for tracking purposes. 
Your request is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW.  You will be contacted within five (5) business days with an update as to when the responsive records will be available.  You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
Again, thank you for your interest in public records of Department of Commerce. 
Department of Commerce

RE: PUBLIC RECORD REQUEST # P001706-022425 
Dear Cody Harris, 
The Department of Commerce received a public records request from you on February 24, 2025, for the following: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Records related to all awardees of the state's Electric Vehicle Charging Program. For each grant recipient, I request: 

* Grant applications 
* Progress reports, milestone reports, and other periodic reporting documents 
* Documents containing proposed and actual charging station locations 
* Budget documents, including proposed and actual expenditures 
* Amendments or modifications to original grant agreements 
* Final project completion reports, if available 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Cody Harris 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-commerce-5573%252Fwashington-state-electric-vehicle-charging-program-181987%252F%253Femail%253Dcommercewa%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AABCmuzFKtmgaEDpBVZ8oaaurWw%3A1tmVcc%3AK_8lGdblEB62snyonBN54QiuRaT9ULcqLLafr2eq5hA" This letter serves as a 5-day acknowledgement of your request. The request has been assigned the following reference number – P001706-022425. PLEASE NOTE THAT A HIGH VOLUME OF REQUESTS IS RESULTING IN A PROLONGED DELAY OF RESPONSES TO RECORD REQUESTS. 
In conducting a search for records, we would like to determine whether there is any further clarification you would like to provide in order for us to best respond to your request. 
Without further clarification from you, we interpret your request as: "You want records related to all awardees in the most recent contract(s) round of the state's Electric Vehicle Charging Program." Along with everything else you listed above in your request submission. 

We would appreciate hearing from you with regard to clarification on this.  Please reply to this request within 7 business days, on or before 03/05/2025. In the event we do not hear from you within 7 business days, on or before 03/05/2025, we will begin to produce records in response to your original request terms and in accordance with our interpretation. 
Based on your response with regard to clarification, or our interpretation of your request if we receive no response from you, we will attempt to gather, identify and review records responsive to your request. We estimate an initial installment of records responsive to your request will be made available to you on or before 04/01/2025. 
Thank You, 
Lynne Hayes

title: Sidney Mecham Case

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Sidney Mecham Case
communications.communication:
Jordan Lassiter
February 23, 2025

FOIA Officer
Portland Police Bureau
1111 SW 2nd Ave
Portland, OR 97204

Subject: Public Records Request – Sidney Mecham Case (Closed) & Demand for Record Preservation

DISCLAIMER:

Please read this FOIA request carefully and abide by all requested points. All communications regarding this request are public and will be disclosed as appropriate.

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law (ORS 192.311 – 192.478), I request access to the following records related to Sidney Mecham’s arrest, investigation, and prosecution for driving through the closed Rose Festival Grand Floral Parade on June 10, 2023. Mecham was convicted and sentenced to five years in prison, making all related law enforcement records subject to public disclosure.

I formally demand the preservation of all responsive records, including but not limited to:
	•	Body-worn camera footage
	•	Dashcam recordings
	•	911 call recordings and transcripts
	•	Police dispatch logs
	•	Arrest reports and investigative files
	•	Internal police communications related to the case

Destroying, altering, or withholding these records without legal justification could constitute a violation of public records law and a due process violation under Chaudhry v. City of Los Angeles, 751 F.3d 1096 (9th Cir. 2014). Further, Public Citizen v. U.S. Dept. of Justice, 491 U.S. 440 (1989) reaffirms the public’s right to government transparency.

1. Body-Worn Camera (BWC) Footage

Requested Records:
	•	All footage from officers who responded to Sidney Mecham’s incident on June 10, 2023.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 133.741 requires law enforcement to retain and disclose BWC footage unless exempt.
	•	ACLU of Nevada v. City of Las Vegas, 333 F.3d 1092 (9th Cir. 2003) confirmed that police bodycam recordings are subject to public records laws.
	•	Reference: ORS 133.741

2. Dashcam Footage

Requested Records:
	•	All police vehicle dashcam recordings related to Mecham’s arrest.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 192.345(3) requires disclosure of police video records unless they interfere with an active case, which is not applicable here.
	•	Hayden v. City of Portland, 183 Or App 647 (2002) established mandatory disclosure of non-exempt police records.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.345(3)

3. 911 Call Recordings and Transcripts

Requested Records:
	•	All 911 call recordings and transcripts related to Mecham’s actions and arrest.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 192.345(3) states that 911 calls are public records unless an exemption applies.
	•	State v. Worthington, 138 Or App 104 (1995) upheld that 911 call transcripts must be disclosed unless privacy outweighs public interest.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.345(3)

4. Police Dispatch Audio and Transcripts

Requested Records:
	•	All officer-dispatch communications related to Sidney Mecham’s arrest.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 192.311 provides for the disclosure of police communication records.
	•	New York Times Co. v. NASA, 852 F.2d 602 (D.C. Cir. 1988) affirmed that public agencies must disclose internal communications unless an exemption applies.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.311

5. Arrest and Booking Reports

Requested Records:
	•	Complete arrest and booking reports related to Mecham’s case, including officer narratives.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 192.345(3) mandates disclosure of completed law enforcement reports.
	•	Afshar v. Dept. of State, 702 F.2d 1125 (D.C. Cir. 1983) held that agencies must disclose non-exempt portions of law enforcement records.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.345(3)

6. Investigative Case Files & Final Police Reports

Requested Records:
	•	All finalized investigative reports, officer statements, and internal police memos regarding the Mecham case.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 192.345(3) confirms that records in closed cases are subject to public disclosure.
	•	Landano v. U.S. Dept. of Justice, 508 U.S. 165 (1993) held that FBI investigative reports must be disclosed unless explicitly exempted.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.345(3)

7. Mugshot and Booking Photos

Requested Records:
	•	Any official mugshot taken of Sidney Mecham at the time of his arrest.

Legal Basis:
	•	ORS 192.355 allows for the disclosure of booking photos unless explicitly exempted.
	•	Detroit Free Press v. DOJ, 829 F.3d 478 (6th Cir. 2016) held that mugshots are public records unless there is a compelling exemption.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.355

Request for Fee Waiver

Pursuant to ORS 192.324(5), I request a waiver of all fees as this request serves the public interest in promoting transparency regarding law enforcement actions and public safety policies.
	•	Public Citizen v. Dept. of Justice, 491 U.S. 440 (1989) held that government information disclosure fosters accountability.
	•	Reference: ORS 192.324(5)

Preservation of Records

I formally demand that all responsive records be preserved under:
	•	44 U.S.C. § 3106 (prohibiting unlawful destruction of public records).
	•	5 U.S.C. § 552 (ensuring preservation of records subject to FOIA requests).

Conclusion

If this request is denied in whole or in part, please provide:
	•	A written explanation citing the specific FOIA exemptions invoked.
	•	All segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

Please confirm receipt of this request and provide an estimated timeline for processing. If clarification is needed, I can be reached at Jordan@Lassiter.eu.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Investigative Journalist 
Jordan@Lassiter.eu

title: 911 Police Dispatch

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: 911 Police Dispatch
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. An accounting of all calls for service (sometimes referred to as "dispatch logs") between the dates of 1/1/20 and 1/31/25. Please provide these in the format in which they are stored in your system, which may be a database, spreadsheet, CSV file, or similar. The format may also be the same as Allegheny County’s 911 dispatches for EMS and Fire, which are published to WPRDC: https://data.wprdc.org/dataset/allegheny-county-911-dispatches-ems-and-fire
The database may include, but not be limited to, properties relating to: call date and time; origin of the call (police-initiated, 911 call, 311 call, etc.); who was dispatched; call disposition; call resolution time.
2. A data dictionary describing the properties present in the table, and how they relate to other records such as published incidents or arrests.
3. Any additional training materials or documentation for how this data is created, or how it should be used internally.

If any part of the request cannot be met, please proceed with the remaining parts.

If any part of the request is denied, please cite the law under which the denial is allowed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Josh Chamberlain

title: AI Use in Federal Workforce Evaluations for Research Purposes (Office of Personnel Management)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: AI Use in Federal Workforce Evaluations for Research Purposes (Office of Personnel Management)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting this Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request under 5 U.S.C. § 552 as part of a policy research project examining the role of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and data analytics in federal workforce evaluation and monitoring. This request is being made to gather publicly available information on AI-driven workforce management tools and policy discussions related to their implementation.  

Requested Records:

1. Documents discussing the use of AI in federal workforce monitoring & evaluation
   - Any memos, reports, internal emails, or policy discussions related to AI, machine learning, or predictive analytics used for employee performance tracking, workforce assessments, or compliance monitoring.  
   - Any internal or external studies commissioned by OPM, DOJ, or EOUSA regarding the use of AI to optimize or evaluate employee performance.

2. Contracts, agreements, or procurement records related to AI-driven workforce tools
   - Any vendor contracts, third-party technology procurements, or government-developed AI tools used for workforce compliance and evaluation.  
   - Documentation on any partnerships with private sector firms, universities, or think tanks to research or implement AI in workforce monitoring.  

3. Legal & policy discussions regarding AI in workforce compliance
   - Any legal opinions, Attorney General reviews, or internal agency discussions on whether AI-driven workforce evaluations align with federal hiring protections under 5 U.S.C. § 2301 and due process requirements under 5 U.S.C. § 7701.
   - Any assessments on the ethical implications of using AI in workforce evaluations, including any risk evaluations related to bias or disparate impact.

I request records from January 1, 2024, to the present in electronic format (PDF or machine-readable format).  If any records are withheld, please provide a Vaughn Index listing the withheld documents and the exemption(s) claimed.  

This request is part of an independent policy research project analyzing the integration of AI in federal workforce operations. It is not related to litigation, investigative reporting, or law enforcement oversight. If any clarification is needed, please contact me before denying any portion of this request.  

Thank you for your time, and I look forward to your response within the 20-business-day timeframe required by 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i).

Sincerely,

Taylor S. Reed

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting this Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request under 5 U.S.C. § 552 as part of a policy research project examining the role of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and data analytics in federal workforce evaluation and monitoring. This request is being made to gather publicly available information on AI-driven workforce management tools and policy discussions related to their implementation.  

Requested Records:

1. Documents discussing the use of AI in federal workforce monitoring & evaluation
   - Any memos, reports, internal emails, or policy discussions related to AI, machine learning, or predictive analytics used for employee performance tracking, workforce assessments, or compliance monitoring.  
   - Any internal or external studies commissioned by OPM, DOJ, or EOUSA regarding the use of AI to optimize or evaluate employee performance.

2. Contracts, agreements, or procurement records related to AI-driven workforce tools
   - Any vendor contracts, third-party technology procurements, or government-developed AI tools used for workforce compliance and evaluation.  
   - Documentation on any partnerships with private sector firms, universities, or think tanks to research or implement AI in workforce monitoring.  

3. Legal & policy discussions regarding AI in workforce compliance
   - Any legal opinions, Attorney General reviews, or internal agency discussions on whether AI-driven workforce evaluations align with federal hiring protections under 5 U.S.C. § 2301 and due process requirements under 5 U.S.C. § 7701.
   - Any assessments on the ethical implications of using AI in workforce evaluations, including any risk evaluations related to bias or disparate impact.

I request records from January 1, 2024, to the present in electronic format (PDF or machine-readable format).  If any records are withheld, please provide a Vaughn Index listing the withheld documents and the exemption(s) claimed.  

This request is part of an independent policy research project analyzing the integration of AI in federal workforce operations. It is not related to litigation, investigative reporting, or law enforcement oversight. If any clarification is needed, please contact me before denying any portion of this request.  

Thank you for your time, and I look forward to your response within the 20-business-day timeframe required by 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i).

Sincerely,

Taylor S. Reed

title: Use of Illinois Arts Council funding for Evanston, IL

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Use of Illinois Arts Council funding for Evanston, IL
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

According to the National Endowment for The Arts (N.E.A.) grant search, the Illinois Arts Council (I.A.C.) receives annual grants from the N.E.A.. For the Grant Period 07/2024 - 12/2025 the NEA reports a grant of $1,146,200. 

This N.E.A. money funds I.A.C. programs in various capacities. It can be inferred, for example, that at the city level, some of this funding is provided to the City of Evanston through the Evanston Arts Council (E.A.C.). 

The specific breakdown of how these funds are divided up is not publicly available. The I.A.C. website instructs individuals to file a F.O.I.A. for cases where this information is desired. 

That said, I request all communication between the Illinois Arts Council and the City of Evanston (including the E.A.C.) regarding grant money from June 2024 to the time that this request is processed. 

Additionally, it would be greatly appreciated if you provided a detailed breakdown of N.E.A. funding allocated to the city of Evanston during this same time frame. 

If applicable, I request that fees be waived as documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sol Thomas

title: FLHSMV UTC Data Request

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FLHSMV UTC Data Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

An export of data from all tables of Uniform Traffic Citation (UTC), Driving Under the Influence (DUI) UTC, UTC Disposition, Arrest- Offense data Fail to Comply (FTC) (D6), and Criminal Financial Oblication data from Florida's Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles Citation/Adjudication Data System. I am requesting data starting in 2011 through the most recent year with full data availability in the system.

From my research I believe that UTC data is administered by the FLHSMV based on the statutory authority 316.650, F.S. [found here: https://www.flsenate.gov/Laws/Statutes/2017/316.650] and 322.20, F.S. [found here: http://m.flsenate.gov/laws/statutes/2018/322.20]. Based on information found in the Uniform Traffic Citation Procedures Manual [found here: https://www.flhsmv.gov/pdf/courts/utc/utccombinedmanual.pdf], the eCitation Interface Control Document [found here: https://www.flhsmv.gov/pdf/courts/utc/eCitation_Interface_Control_Document_6.1.pdf], the Traffic Citation Accounting Transmission System (TCATS) Interface Control Document (ICD) [found here: https://www.flhsmv.gov/pdf/courts/utc/tcats_icd_6_0_1.pdf] and the Uniform Traffic Citation Training presentation [found here: https://www.flhsmv.gov/pdf/courts/utc/2021_trcc_utc_grant_workshop.pdf] I understand UTC data is transmitted from issuing law enforcement agencies within five days of the offence date to the Florida Clerks of the Court (COC) for processing and are then validated and transferred via the Florida Court Clerks & Comptroller's Association (FCCC) Traffic Citation Accounting Transmission System (TCATS) to the FLHSMV within 10 days of disposition.

My request is for the validated UTC and disposition data that the FLHSMV currently has in its database(s). My request is for all non-exempt columns from tables in the FLHSMV citation/adjudication database which based on my research should include but is not limited to:

I request these records in their native digital formats and not in formats that degrade the accessibility of the records, such as tabular data converted to PDF or Word files. If converting the native digital format to another high-fidelity format, such as CSV or Excel, please take care not to introduce formatting inconsistencies or errors, which can occur in the conversion process (for example, encoding errors or the inclusion of internal unescaped quotation marks in CSV files). Should the records above represent certain values as numeric codes or abbreviations that are not self-explanatory, we additionally request all records necessary to interpret those codes and abbreviations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adrian Nesta
